question: You are running a simulation that requires you to repeat the process multiple times to ensure accuracy. If each run of the simulation takes 15 minutes and you plan to run it 8 times, how long in total will it take to complete all runs of the simulation?
solution:
To find the total time, multiply the time per run by the number of runs.

Total time = Time per run × Number of runs = 15 minutes × 8 = 120 minutes

Thus, the total time to complete all runs of the simulation is 

\[
\boxed{120 \text{ minutes}}
\]
